1.author: MasterBeeble
1.body:
Winner of WC in 2018: France.  Winner of CL: Real Madrid.  Winner of BdO: Luka Modric, Real Madrid.

Winner of WC in 2014: Germany.  Winner of CL: Real Madrid.  Winner of BdO: Cristano Ronaldo, Real Madrid, joint UCL top scorer (with Messi).

Winner of WC in 2010: Spain.  Winner of CL: Chelsea.  Winner of BdO: Lionel Messi, despite the fact many of his Barcelona teammates shared all his club results AND won the World Cup on top of that.  (Messi was by far the best player in the world at the time, but still.  Even a full WC advantage didn't matter at all.)

Winner of WC in 2006: Italy.  Winner of CL: Barcelona.  Winner of BdO: Fabio Cannavaro, Italy, Juventus.  That's how far back you have to go, and Cannavaro wasn't just handed that award because of the WC, he had won Serie A footballer of the year (and also Serie A defender the year before).  He was a top contender at club level for whom the WC probably pushed him over the edge.  Moreover, this was two decades ago, and the focus has since shifted more heavily to UCL goal counts, mostly because it was necessary to justify handing Ronaldo BdOs when Messi was by far the best player in the world.

1.author: ChetHolmgrenSings
1.body:
> Winner of WC in 2018: France. Winner of CL: Real Madrid. Winner of BdO: Luka Modric, Real Madrid

Right, Ronaldo had a better year on the same team but the WC final appearance gave Luka the win. Ronaldo didn't even have that bad of a WC, I think he scored a hattrick against Spain that summer. Still lost to Luka. 

That helps my point that the WC is the difference maker as Luka didn't even win the final. Varane and Griezmann of France were the only Frenchmen that would have even been considered (neither better than Ronaldo in La liga that year), but people assumed Cristiano would win.

1.author: MasterBeeble
1.body:
Of course the WC matters, I'm not trying to claim it's irrelevant.  What I'm explaining to you is that the CL is much, much more important.  I don't even think it should be that way, it's just how it is.

>Varane and Griezmann of France were the only Frenchmen that would have even been considered, but people assumed Cristiano would win.

Gee, I wonder why.  If only there was a competition in which Cristiano's performance could have earned him the BdO above any and all WC winners.  Reminder that CR had won the last 2 consecutive BdOs on the basis of him top scoring + winning the last 2 CLs.  Did the WC manage to make enough of a difference to squeak Modric by him?  Sure.  Was Modric the better player, and should Modric have outplaced Ronaldo in the 2017 BdO as well?  Yes.

1.author: ChetHolmgrenSings
1.body:
> Did the WC manage to make enough of a difference to squeak Modric by him? Sure. 

And the same will happen for Messi but this time Messi won it, not a runner's up so he'll be a mile ahead.

> Was Modric the better player, and should Modric have outplaced Ronaldo in the 2017 BdO as well? Yes.

Idk if I agree with this tbh

6.author: catsNpokemon
6.body:
> lmao, you had 3 days rest that's plenty.

No it's not, especially when the average time between your games played is less than 3 days. Fatigue builds up. Players still have to train and prepare before each game too. It's not like they're literally resting for three entire days. That's why a gap of 3 days and 7 days is so big, and I'm 110% sure you'd be saying the same thing if you were in the same situation. 

Also, ETH intentionally set the team up to be very defensive. It was the best chance of getting a result considering the circumstances. You need to stop focusing so much on stats and actually look at what the players are doing. You weren't dominant at Old Trafford at all, wonder why?

6.author: Cardealer1000
6.body: It's delusional to think it should be an interesting final?

6.author: Cardealer1000
6.body:
We still dominated possession and touches in the box at Old trafford, just made mistakes that led to goals.

I did watch what the players were doing, they got outclassed at the Emirates, but football is a funny sport so being the much better team doesn't always get you the result, thankfully it did this time.

Edit: It's 3 days vs 6 days btw, not 7, we played Spurs 4:30 Sunday then united 4:30 next sunday. 3 days is a standard amount of rest, 2 days is when it gets dodgy.

6.author: catsNpokemon
6.body:
> We still dominated possession and touches in the box at Old trafford, just made mistakes that led to goals.

Possession means nothing. I thought this was clear to everyone by now. Touches in the box sure, I guess it shows you attacked more than us, but we created the better chances that game by far. I don't remember you guys creating many chances at all.

6.author: Cardealer1000
6.body:
xG for that game at old trafford was pretty even, some had in slightly in our favour, some in yours. We deserved to lose that game, shit happens, but we didn't play terribly.

xG for the game at the Emirates was like 3 to 0.3, not close at all, United got lucky but like I said it was a very flattering scoreline. 

I'm not *just* using the stats because these are the thoughts I got from actually watching the game live. After the fact the stats supported the thoughts that my eyes had given me.

That's the fun of football, you get crazy scorelines and shock results because of how the game is and being the better team doesn't guarantee a certain result.

8.body:
Yeah, didn't have fewer start than them. What happened was that Cazorla got injured and Ramsey was moved back to midfield, with Walcott taking Ramsey's place on the wing (if my memory serves me right).   


Either way, Cech was worse than Walcott (and Welbeck) that season. His numbers were truly average. He had the second worst save rate in the league from 18 yards or more, which is significant, because our defense didn't allow many shots from inside 18 yards anyway. Leno was a major upgrade.

8.body: I’m not trying to be annoying or anything but walcott was legitimately horrendous the second half of that season. Got injured in our league cup loss around october and couldnt do anything right for months after he came back. Welbz barely played, came back, seemed to be getting in form and got a long term injury again at man city iirc. I will say cech was overall more reliable than our previous keepers imo, but he was not the difference maker we were promised. And yes leno really was a breath of fresh air after cech, ospina, szczesny, almunia, fabiansky

10.author: Mapleyy
10.body: From what I understand reddit banned the domain streamff.com, copying the url works fine but reddit changes the link from streamff.com to streamff.co (which has been hijacked) when you actually try to submit clips. By default it redirects to streamff.com but since it's a domain not controlled by the real streamff they can replace the clips at will.

11.author: Chelseafc5505
11.body:
"What is the difference between buy-out and release clauses?Buy-out clauses are prevalent in Spain and are somewhat different to a release clause. They are a mandatory element of most Spanish contracts and are usually set at a very high figure which is not necessarily the true market value of the player. The player has to literally 'buy out' his contract at the stipulated amount, though in practice, it is the purchasing club who pays the amount via the player. This can be a complicated process because of the practical tax logistics of a purchasing club transferring the 'buy-out' fee to the player who will in turn buy out his contract."

https://www.danielgeey.com/done-deal-blog/buy-out-release-clauses-in-football-the-basics

And a second link just for fun
http://www.football-news-views.co.uk/football-news-1313-do-you-know-the-difference-between-release-clauses-and-buy-out-clauses.php

Edit: the reason a release clause can be amortized, is because the money is exchanging hands for an asset. 
In the case of a buyout clause, you are giving the player $xxxx to buy out their contract, and are not buying an asset with that money. Also has drastically different tax implications.

11.author: Much-Ad-7260
11.body: Then you probably mixed that up since like your source claims, buy-out clause is mandatory in Portugal and Spain so Enzo was binded by buy-out clause, which like you said, can't be amortized.

11.author: Chelseafc5505
11.body:
Which we didn't trigger dopey, we just happened to make an offer of the same amount. 

That's why the negotiations took forever.

11.author: Much-Ad-7260
11.body: Negotiations took forever because Boehly used third party firm to pay it in full because otherwise you would breach FFP.

11.author: Chelseafc5505
11.body:
What point are you even trying to make at this point lol?

Release clause ≠ buyout clauses

Release clauses can be amortized because you are purchasing an asset, who's value can be spread across the contract length

Buyout clauses cannot, because you are giving a player the money to buy himself out of his contract. 

That's it. You were wrong, and confidently wrong at that. Leave it alone.

11.author: Much-Ad-7260
11.body:
You are funny I have to admit. Chelsea won't amortize it since it wasn't release clause as you said, but buy out clause. 

Only thing that Chelsea will amortize is money they will pay to that third party.

And even that isn't technically amortization. Those are loan payments.

11.author: Chelseafc5505
11.body:
I don't believe that any 3rd party was involved. It was rumoured to be last ditch option for us if the other bid structures weren't accepted. 

More info will come out about the specifics, which aren't 100% clear as of yet, but I believe the clause in his contract was £105m. In order to get them to agree to the deal, we offered over that at £115m on the condition it could be done in 6 installments. ie we can amortize it over his 8.5 year contract. 

But that, along with anything else out there at this point is speculation.

11.author: Chelseafc5505
11.body:
This should clear up some of your misconceptions.

https://www.thickaccent.com/2023/01/26/is-the-e120m-put-on-enzo-fernandez-a-buyout-or-release-clause-explained/

13.author: ayotui
13.body:
He's still a champions league winner with an ego to match though. 

If he was under the impression that you were offering him a longer deal and you weren't why wouldn't he back out of the deal? 

If his agents are telling him all through the transfer that the deal is until 2024 with european football, and on the last day it turns out to be 6 months and no european football. Why wouldn't Isco feel insulted by that? 

If all the cards had been on the table from the start and everyone understood each other clearly then that's different, but from Iscos point of view this looks like you reneging on the deal at the last minute. While from your point of view it looks like Iscos camp looking for more at the last minute.

13.author: Pek-Man
13.body:
It's not Union's problem that Isco has an ego which doesn't match his actual value as a player. 

Sure, we can keep discussing how both camps probably misread the situation and each other. My point will inevitably be that Union didn't miss out on too much, and that it's in fact even possible that they dodged a bullet.

13.author: ayotui
13.body:
I don't disagree tbh. 

My read on it is that if everyone had been open and honest from the start Isco would have walked away much earlier and no one would ever know there were even talks about him joining Union.

13.body: Fair enough, that's a valid point!

21.author: Dsalgueiro
21.body:
No tengo ni idea de como se escribe en español.

Frequentemente no Twitter eu converso com alguns argentinos sobre futebol. Eles escrevem em espanhol, eu em português e nos entendemos muito bem hahaha.

Eu acho muito fácil de entender o espanhol escrito, já o espanhol falado depende da nacionalidade. Alguns países falam mais rápido que os outros, o que deixa mais difícil de entender.

Me pergunto se é a mesma coisa com o português para o restante da América do Sul.

21.author: andysenn
21.body:
Si, leerlo es fácil, más si uno lo leé en voz alta. 

>Alguns países falam mais rápido que os outros, o que deixa mais difícil de entender.

Pasa lo mismo, algunos brasileros hablan muy rápido o muy cerrado y es más difícil. Creo que es más fácil para ustedes entendernos hablar que para nosotros entender portugués, pero escrito no hay problema.

PS: Pare de comprar nossos bons jogadores. Nossa liga já é ruim o suficiente.

21.author: Dsalgueiro
21.body:
>PS: Pare de comprar nossos bons jogadores. Nossa liga já é ruim o suficiente.

Eu tenho uma péssima notícia para você...

A tendência é isso aumentar nos próximos anos. Além de clubes como Palmeiras e Flamengo, que são capazes de fazer investimentos na casa de 20 milhões de euros, agora tem clubes como o Bahia, que é do Grupo City.

Acredito que o Grupo City vai reunir os jogadores que contratam na América do Sul no Bahia ao invés de manda-los para clubes menores da Europa.

Botafogo e Vasco, clubes que há mais de década não conseguiam fazer investimentos, agora também possuem donos (John Textor e 777), tanto que o Botafogo quase comprou o Ojeda ano passado e o Vasco gastou R$ 90 milhões nessa janela.

Próximo clube que deve ser vendido é o Atlético Mineiro. Acredito que em 2024 vamos voltar a fazer investimentos maiores no mercado. Não é atoa que liberamos espaço para jogadores estrangeiros no elenco (Em 2022 tínhamos Junior Alonso, Matías Zaracho, Nacho Fernández, Cristian Pavón e Eduardo Vargas de estrangeiros. Em 2023 sobraram apenas Zaracho, Pavón e Vargas. Não devemos utilizar as duas vagas restantes em 2023).

Para completar, é previsto para 2023 a criação da Liga Brasileira já com acordo de venda para grupo de investidores. Por enquanto os clubes estão se organizando em dois grupos, mas para a criação definitiva vão precisar chegar num acordo e se unir.

A proposta recebida por um dos grupos:

[https://ge.globo.com/negocios-do-esporte/noticia/2023/01/30/serengeti-oferece-r-485-bilhoes-para-se-tornar-socia-de-potencial-liga-de-clubes-veja-detalhes.ghtml](https://ge.globo.com/negocios-do-esporte/noticia/2023/01/30/serengeti-oferece-r-485-bilhoes-para-se-tornar-socia-de-potencial-liga-de-clubes-veja-detalhes.ghtml)

21.author: andysenn
21.body:
Si, se que solo va a empeorar. Pero bueno, es realmente triste el estado de nuestra liga. La Copa Libertadores ya es básicamente Copa do Brasil parte II: A vingança de Adrian.

Yo creo que no nos va a quedar otra que cambiar la situación de los clubes para que sean financiados por privados. Por lo menos si queremos competir minimamente con Brasil

21.author: Dsalgueiro
21.body:
Eu acho que o que pode ajudar a Liga Argentina a longo prazo, além de clubes argentinos serem financiados por privados, é o fato de clubes brasileiros começarem a fazer um trabalho sério nas "canteras".

O Brasil sempre revelou grandes quantidades de jogadores, mas nenhum clube nunca fez um projeto realmente sério nas categorias de jovens. Os primeiros a fazerem um projeto mais organizado são exatamente o Palmeiras e o Flamengo.

Agora todo ano saem bons jogadores das categorias de jovens desses dois clubes, diminuindo assim a necessidade de contratar jogadores de outros países.

O Palmeiras só vai negociar o Merentiel e o Flaco Lopez porque aposta que o Endrick (jovem revelado pelo clube) e o Rony (um extremo que atuou várias vezes de falso 9 com o Abel) podem ser suficientes num primeiro momento na posição. Além disso, devem utilizar os extremos Giovani e o Kevin, ambos revelados pelo clube, no time principal... O que liberaria o Rony para ser um falso 9 com maior frequência.

Alias, o Kevin teve proposta de 10 milhões de euros do Shakhtar... E olha que ele nem é um jovem do mesmo nível do Giovani, muito menos do Endrick.

Sobre a Libertadores... Nós, brasileiros, também não gostamos de ver a competição nesse estado, mas acabou ficando inevitável por conta do abismo financeiro. Hoje realmente virou uma Copa do Brasil 2

Pelo menos a Conmebol aumentou a premiação da competição. Até pouco tempo atrás a Copa do Brasil pagava mais que a Libertadores para o campeão.

25.author: cuentanueva

This was an 'I'm bored  I'll comment' sort of thing. Feel free to make your own decisions, It's fun anyway.

25.author: letsgetitfellas
25.body: Yeah I was stuck on that for a while tbh. Was considering making all league titles the same value (maybe 2.5?) but thought I have to weight the more competitive leagues higher somewhat.

25.author: letsgetitfellas
25.body:
Yeah that definitely could be done but the way I've set out the list there are basically 17 columns for each of the 17 competitions I listed, then 1 extra column for miscellaneous competitions. It would be much more complicated working out a value for each individual player for every league title they've won but I appreciate your point. 

Also, I agree, Messi will overtake Alves by the end of next season assuming 1 more season at PSG.

25.author: letsgetitfellas
25.body: Exactly right. It's even harder to determine points values for defunct and miscellaneous competitions, so I've basically just given it my best guess for the time being

30.author: Marauder2
30.body: Again, you have thrown out this accusation based on nothing but conjecture. There is nothing to suggest he did it deliberately.

30.author: Difficult-Host8147
30.body:
There is also nothing to suggest that he didn't, that's why I said agree to disagree.

And even so, my second paragraph is still true regardless

30.author: Marauder2
30.body:
It’s innocent until proven guilty, when you make an accusation like that the burden is on you to provide evidence to back upwhat you are saying. You cannot point to anything at all to back up what you are saying. On the other hand, I can point to his history to show he has never done what you are saying, therefore it doesn’t make sense. 

And no your second paragraph is still not true regardless. You can’t ask how many young players are going to have their careers ruined by him based on one tackle? If he did this week in and week out then yes.

30.author: Difficult-Host8147
30.body:
That's why I said agree to disagree, I have no intention to convince biased Liverpool fans further. Do you not understand what "agree to disagree" means? That career-ending tackle was there for the whole world to see, and nobody can confirm for sure what was Fabinho really thinking, so you can keep your biased thinking for yourself.

I said I fear for them, because this blatant tackle was not punished at all, which only encourages him to do it more, especially when football-wise Fabinho will keep being frustrated for a foreseeable future.

30.author: Marauder2
30.body:
Naw you don’t get it. It is a fact that you have not provided any real reason to justify your accusation. You have thrown something out there with nothing to back it up. This is not something that we can disagree on, it is fact. You just say he is frustrated and therefore tried to end someone’s career. This is such a leap and makes no sense. 

I am not looking at it from a biased point of view, objectively you have not given any valid reason to justify your accusation that this player would deliberately try to end someone’s career.

Just because I cannot say for sure that he didn’t go out there with that intention, that isn’t a valid reason to accuse people of things. Innocent until proven guilty, not guilty until proven innocent.

30.author: Difficult-Host8147
30.body:
This is what I think, I really don't care if you agree or not. You're trying to get me to agree to your point, which I won't, because my personal thought is different from yours. This is not a case in court.

So yeah it's confirmed, you don't understand what "agree to disagree" is. It is sad, probably not as sad as Fabinho's ending youngsters' careers, but it is still sad.

30.author: Marauder2
30.body: What we can agree on is that it is what you think, and that it is no based on anything factual. That’s all I’m saying.

30.author: Difficult-Host8147
30.body: That's why I said "agree to disagree", for like the 4th time already. Jaysus...

Not all teams play the same system and not all DMs play the same role, you can’t really say he’s just suitable there in the whole of English football. 33.author: Dawhood
33.body:
Kyriakopoulos usually plays further forward (especially this season) and him coming in to replace Vignato just shouts "Left Winger in Motta's 4231". 

Cambiaso however can also play on both wings of the defence so he will get gametime even if Kyriakopoulos ends up appearing at LB every once in a while.

33.author: Natrix31
33.body:
Are you sure that's a usually? From what I recall, he's only played lw so much this season bc of injuries, and played a lot of lb under De Zerbi. I guess Bologna could be recruiting him for that, but I don't buy it. 

Transfermarkt has him with only 7 games at lw in his career, all being this season: https://www.transfermarkt.com/georgios-kyriakopoulos/leistungsdatendetails/spieler/311178/plus/1?saison=&verein=&liga=&wettbewerb=&pos=11&trainer_id=

33.author: Dawhood
33.body:
I can’t really quantify it like transfermarkt but yeah this year I’m quite sure he’s been playing up the pitch the vast majority of the time. Last season he was starting at LB, but Sassuolo’s left winger was mainly Traoré who plays very central so he pushed up all the time, he’s hardly a defensive fullback.

It would make no sense for Bologna to loan out a winger and take Kyriakoupolos just to make him play LB when they already have two starting options.

33.author: Natrix31
33.body: Yea I agree, just surprised Bologna would use him in that role and they wouldn’t release Cambiaso, however Soriano is starting there and he’s been dreadful.

38.author: zeekoes
38.body: Would've been a dumb decision. To my knowledge he has no experience as a TD.

38.author: Sunstridr
38.body:
He was doing that job for Go Ahead before he sold his share in Go Ahead (although under the mantle of part owner).

I remember specifically him being apart of the negotiations for Jay Gorter.

38.author: zeekoes
38.body:
I have my doubt about the ghosting, since we only know one - heavily pushed narrative by De Telegraaf - side of the story anyways. I also don't see why he would qualify from a casual authority driven technical position to be a dream candidate for TD at Ajax. 

Supported the idea for RvC member, but definitely not TD.

38.author: Sunstridr
38.body:
Definitely, but you don't ask someone to sell their shares in a club if you aren't very close to agreeing something.

Personally don't view him as a dream candidate, that would be De Conde for me, but have an average TD would be a lot better than this mess we are in now with no TD, no permanent coach and no Football knowing RVC member.

38.author: Sunstridr
38.body:
According to the AD (so potentially true), VDS was the main reason Ajax ghosted Kroes, as VDS wanted to do the job of TD.

Ajax had said to Kroes "sell your shares" and then VDS rushed through the appointment of Schreuder, while convincing the RVC to let him do the job with H2 as his "loopjongens".

38.author: zeekoes
38.body:
Hamstra has as much if not more experience as a TD. But just like Go Ahead Eagles, Heerenveen is not comparable.

And a new permanent coach would be extremely questionable so soon.

38.author: zeekoes
38.body:
Sounds like complete BS. AD is no better than De Telegraaf when it comes to this shit.

They all have these wild stories about the inner workings of Ajax, with no backing evidence or even quotes and a vested interest in selling the drama. Yet when you line up all these narratives they don't make sense.

How can Van der Sar be accused of not having a backbone, no control over the RvC during transfer season, having no clue what's going on, while also having so much power and assertiveness to strongarm the RvC in giving him a cart blanche?

It never makes sense.

38.author: Sunstridr
38.body:
>And a new permanent coach would be extremely questionable so soon.

Definitely agree with this, and it wasn't my intention to come across that Ajax should rush into getting a new coach.

Was just saying that things wouldn't have been in such a mess if Ajax had even an average TD.

38.author: Sunstridr
38.body:
If it wasn't that both Freek Jansen and Verweij were almost constantly giving small snippets that match up with this story, I wouldn't believe it.

But they have, like with the loop jongens stuff was more or less stated by both.

VDS could have easily convinced (not strong armed) the RVC to wait a while to see if things go well under him/Schreuder, thereby causing the non appointment of Kroes.

Schreuder probably was quickly convinced with the promise of one or two signings of his choice and the impossible "only 4 players would be sold" promise.

And when United came in for Licha and later Antony, with the RVC saying "too expensive" to both Ziyech/Bailey and whoever we had scouted for LCB, VDS probably panicked and started asking Schreuder for solutions (because Schreuder had helped Ajax before with Tadic).

38.author: zeekoes
38.body:
Yes, you've got snippets. Pieces of unccorroborated information without context molded in a narrative that paints Van der Sar as incompetent.
The same narrative that's now floating the idea that Van der Sar fired Overmars too quickly, while at the time he should've have resigned because he wasn't quick enough.

They're throwing everything at the wall to damage Van der Sar and see what sticks.

39.author: Puckinception
39.body:
Okay dude -

The story of Corden being banned from the restaurant came out barely last year. Many other stories came out before that. It doesn't say anything if YOU only find out about them through reddit. I'm literally telling you there's articles written about this guy being the twat of Hollywood. It didn't spread through just reddit..like that's the only form of social media or news outlet in the world. Jfc. Your personal experience is not everything. I'm sure throwaway reddit comments are ruining his life and not his own doings. 

I don't even disagree that he's innocent until proven guilty in the court of law on the Alves case anyway. Evidence is damning and not just his retelling of the story. That's all.

39.author: AnnieIWillKnow
39.body:
Um what are you talking about? I didn’t “change it” - I’m on the mobile app right now and I’m not even sure how to do that from it. As far as I’ve known (on old Reddit at least) our mod list has always been public. We can turn the green mod flair off and on on our comments - and I didn’t have it on initially as I did not think I’d need to “prove” this to you, beyond my word. 

You’re literally throwing around accusations of things I haven’t done, and then spouting off about “innocent until proven guilty”. The irony is too much.

So, simple question. Do you think what I have told you is true? That the explanation I have provided is the truth of the conversation between myself and the other moderators?

39.author: AnnieIWillKnow
39.body:
I can tell you now that I did not change it. 

> How would I know if a conversation you've had with other moderators happened or not?

Because I have told you that they did.

On both counts, if you do not believe me, then you are saying these claims are lies, and hence calling me a liar.

The irony of you throwing around these unsubstantiated accusations, and being unwilling to give me the benefit of the doubt - and yet so keenly advocating for us to extend that "moral" courtesy to a footballer accused of rape... that's really quite something.

39.author: AnnieIWillKnow
39.body:
If you don't believe I am telling you the truth, you are calling me a liar.

Don't worry though, I won't be suing you for libel. I reserve the right to use this conversation to make judgements on your morals, however - but I'll keep my thoughts to myself.

39.author: AnnieIWillKnow
39.body:
You don’t think I’m telling you the truth, that’s pretty clear. Simply, you don’t believe me. 

I wonder how far you extend this non judgemental approach. Your mate tells you that they saw a mutual friend at Tesco, and your response is “I will have to reserve judgment on this claim”? 

The only laughable thing here is you completely failing to see the irony of this situation, and then still morally aggrandising.

39.author: AnnieIWillKnow
39.body:
I’m half tempted to send you the screenshots to give you the empirical evidence you so desire, but I won’t lower myself. 

This conversation doesn’t make you look half as smart and morally superior as you think. It just makes you look like someone who got shown up for making false claims, and then has been unable to have the maturity and insight to hold their hands up and admit it. 

I’ll give you the benefit of the doubt, and believe you aren’t being intentionally malicious, with your intent, though.

40.author: timdeking
40.body: I highly doubt we would sell Kökçü at this time and I also doubt Kökçü would want to go to Benfica right now. I don't think anything under 50m would even be considered, because we are in the middle of a title race.

40.author: hamzaiswack
40.body: I dont think feyenoord want to sell kokcu but there is no chance in hell they would refuse 35-40m

40.author: timdeking
40.body: At this point in the window? While we're on top of the league halfway through the season? No way. We will still get that for him in the summer. If we sell him now we are basically saying goodbye to our title and CL chances for this season.

40.author: hamzaiswack
40.body: Do you think you will get 40m for kokcu? You arent ajax, good luck bro.

40.author: timdeking
40.body:
Neither is PSV and they just sold an extremely injury prone player who has never played 5 consecutive matches for 35m. 

Feyenoord doesn't have to sell anymore and Kökçü is our captain, has a ton of (international) experience for his age (he just turned 22 a month ago) and has great stats both on and off the ball. He's probably the best midfielder in the league right now. What kind of price tag would you give him?

40m might be on the higher side, but with the fees that are being thrown around nowadays it's not out of the question. 35m should be the minimum.

40.author: hamzaiswack
40.body: I really do hope you get it but i think it will be amazing if you guys can get 30m. The only reason madueke went for the amount he went for is because he is young and english.

41.author: I_always_rated_them
41.body: and yet you decided to continue it by lying. Just accept you made a mistake and said something wrong. That's ok.

41.author: Alternative_Twist_39
41.body: I didn’t lie. I never claimed to know what goes on behind the scenes at any club, mine included. I just stated an opinion that you didn’t like. I regret it tho. Chelsea fans are rude and annoying. Still didn’t lie tho. 😘

41.author: I_always_rated_them
41.body: Yeah sorry you didn't lie, you just stated something moronic with nothing to back it up because it's been normalised by your club. As good as a lie, but at least you regret it I suppose.

41.author: Alternative_Twist_39
41.body: Really driving home my point about rude and annoying. Also entitled. But at least you don’t talk to people like that in person. 😂

41.author: I_always_rated_them
41.body:
You're just throwing words out there now, how on earth is anything I've said "entitled". 

I'm sorry that I'm too brash for your soft Mancunian(lol ofc not) sensibilities.

41.author: Alternative_Twist_39
41.body: Now you’re a gatekeeper? Damn. You really must enjoy being a dick. This isn’t even a conversation about football anymore, you’ve gotten so upset that you’ve decided to keep coming back for more. Take a break. Btw you just showcased entitlement lmao.

41.author: I_always_rated_them
41.body: You don't know what entitlement is and I'm not gatekeeping you.

41.author: Alternative_Twist_39
41.body: I do know what entitlement is. Your last comment implies that because I’m not from Manchester, I’m somehow a lesser fan, therefore gatekeeping PL fandom which is also a form of entitlement.

41.author: I_always_rated_them
41.body: No it does't. That's your fragility projecting that onto a joke, I don't care if you're not local. In any case you had previously accused me of entitlement lmao.

41.author: Alternative_Twist_39
41.body: Ok, king. This is tiring. Have a good day.

42.author: Far-Pineapple7113
42.body: I think even VDB is worse

42.author: BrockStar92
42.body: Yeah I’d say so. Although I suppose you could argue Maguire was 35m overpriced and VDB cost about 35m total so they were similarly wasted amounts.

42.author: Far-Pineapple7113
42.body: Maguire has actually had long periods when he has been useful on the field except the horrible last year ,Vdb hasn't even contributed anything worth 5 m when on the field

42.author: BrockStar92
42.body: Well yes, I agree. I’m just saying that relatively speaking both wasted about 35m in costs. Ofc that’s just one way to view it, and I wouldn’t generally agree with that viewpoint (since having VDB meant not signing a different midfielder).

43.author: WickeDemon15
43.body: I think where we differ is our interpretation of a push. I don’t see this as a push, there are many moments when you make contact to jostle for possession. What helps your argument is there is no valid attempt to play the ball. Where we don’t see eye to eye is the “denial of goal scoring opportunity.” The defender does not deny him the chance to score. This would not be a foul anywhere else on the field.

43.author: jonnyvonjonny
43.body:
I'm with you on the jostling, but to be honest I have never thought that using one's arms to push or pull someone around counted as jostling.
Regarding denying a goalscoring opportunity: if a player is through on goal and he's running at full pace, and the defender pulls out an arm and tips him off balance, not playing at the ball, and he falls over, or even if he ends up unbalanced enough to miskew his shot, isn't that technically denying a goalscoring opportunity?

43.author: WickeDemon15
43.body: The opportunity is still there to be had. The attacker chooses to accept the foul. If I’m the ref, it’s a no call for either simulation or the “foul.”

43.author: jonnyvonjonny
43.body:
I agree with you that attackers shouldn't be falling unless they legitimately fall.  


But what if the push is enough to unbalance the attacker and he misses the shot as a result? Surely that isn't the attacker deciding to accept the foul?

44.author: PringleJones

44.author: PringleJones

46.author: Divolinon
46.body: Ah, so the opposite from what the title says. They do have permission to avoid a home advantage.

46.author: stella__art
46.body: How is it the opposite from the title lol

46.author: Divolinon
46.body:
Title says they're not allowed to avoid the home advantage. The article says that they ARE allowed to avoid the home advantage. And they did.

Comma's mather: It's like

"Let's eat grandma."

and

"Let's eat, grandma."

A better title would be:

"To avoid a home advantage for Beveren, fans will not be allowed."

46.author: stella__art
46.body:
Both are correct, it's clear that the fixture has Genk as home team and one would assume that this game would allow fans no matter where it is played.

If the game was played at Vise fans would be allowed

46.author: Divolinon
46.body: It certainly wasn't clear to me. It made no sense to me till I read the article.

47.author: patric8989
47.body: The top 7 in Italy are on a different level to the other teams. Seventh is only attainable this year because Juve have a massive points deduction, that's not going to be there every season.

47.body: I’m clearly talking about this season

47.author: patric8989
47.body: But Ilic isnt signing for just this season. If the best his new club can ever hope for is to maybe challenge for a conference league spot is that really ambitious?

47.author: Natrix31
47.body:
This is still a major step up from fighting against relegation, and he’s guaranteed consistent playing time in the country he’d like to remain fighting for Europe. 

He’s 21 years old and has plenty of time to develop into a UCL player, and Torino keep him if a god offer comes in.

48.author: New-Pin-3952
48.body: I follow Everton news closely and never heard him being linked. When was that?

48.author: T_Chishiki
48.body: Look at Man United signing Weghorst, who is also a physical striker at ~30 years old. The market is there and Füllkrug is prolific and in the form of his life.

48.author: T_Chishiki
48.body: [Bild reported on it.](https://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/werder-bremen/bundesliga-klub-interessiert-sich-fuer-niclas-fuellkrug-82591130.bild.html) That was about two weeks ago.

48.author: New-Pin-3952
48.body: Not a peep about it over here. Most likely his agent pushing bullshit trying to raise interest in his client for his 'one last big move'. He's 30 in 10 days and they're quoting €20 million for him. Not a fucking chance mate.

48.author: T_Chishiki
48.body: Fair enough, who knows. Nobody expected United to go for Weghorst either, but here we are.

48.author: New-Pin-3952
48.body:
Slightly different story here. Ten Hag and Weghorst are both Dutch and he knows him from when he managed in Netherlands. He suits his style of play too. He was cheap loan. Ok for backup or as a rotation player.

Fullkrug link doesn't make any sense for Everton though. 30yo €20 million signing on most likely fairly big wages. Come on. Saying that I wouldn't be surprised if Everton board went for that deal, they're incompetent idiots.
